[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/eager.rs] [Impl: ScriptLoader::load_script()] [Type Tag Dependencies Order] Are type tag dependencies charged before or after script verification - can verification fail after gas is spent? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Struct: LazyLoader::new()] [Module Storage Reference Safety] Does the module_storage reference remain valid for the entire loader lifetime, or can storage be mutated/dropped while loader still holds reference? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: charge_module()] [Visit Tracking Bypass] Can attackers manipulate the TraversalContext to mark modules as already visited when they haven't been, bypassing gas charges? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: charge_module()] [Special Module Detection Bypass] What prevents attackers from registering malicious modules at special addresses (0x0, 0x1) to get free module loading? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: charge_module()] [Module Size Integer Overflow] Can unmetered_get_existing_module_size() return sizes that overflow u64 when converted to NumBytes, causing incorrect gas charges? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: charge_module()] [Gas Charging Race Condition] Between checking visit_if_not_special_module_id() and charging gas, can the module be modified causing incorrect size to be charged? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: charge_module()] [DependencyKind::Existing Abuse] Is DependencyKind::Existing always appropriate here, or can module publishing exploit this to pay lower gas rates? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_load_module()] [Lazy Verification Safety] Does unmetered_get_existing_lazily_verified_module() properly ensure module safety, or can unverified modules leak through? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_load_module()] [Module Verification State Race] Between charging gas and loading module, can another transaction modify the module's verification state? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_load_module()] [Error Location Loss] Finishing errors with Location::Undefined - does this hide critical information about where module loading failed? (Low)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_load_type()] [Recursive Type Metering] For deeply nested generic types, is gas charged for each level of nesting or only for top-level structs? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_load_type()] [Type Builder Safety] Can the type builder's create_ty() function be exploited to create invalid types that bypass Move's type safety? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_load_type()] [Module Loading in Type Construction] When loading a module for struct definition during type construction, is the module properly metered and verified? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_verify_and_cache_script()] [Script Hash Collision] Like eager loader, this uses sha3_256 - can preimage attacks find collisions to poison script cache? (Critical)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_verify_and_cache_script()] [Early Return Gas Bypass] When returning early for cached verified scripts, is gas properly charged for all immediate dependencies before returning? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_verify_and_cache_script()] [Dependency Iteration Order] Does the order of iterating immediate_dependencies_iter() match the order in which they were charged, ensuring deterministic gas? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_verify_and_cache_script()] [Script Verification Atomicity] Between building locally_verified_script and verified_script, can module states change causing verification inconsistencies? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_verify_and_cache_script()] [Cache Insertion Race] Can concurrent insert_verified_script() calls cause the wrong script version to be cached? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Function: metered_verify_and_cache_script()] [Deserialized Script State] If a Deserialized script is found in cache, is it safe to verify it or could it contain corrupted data from a failed previous verification? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: StructDefinitionLoader::is_lazy_loading_enabled()] [Debug Assert Bypass in Release] Like eager loader, uses debug_assert! - can production code violate this assumption? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: StructDefinitionLoader::load_struct_definition()] [Struct Name Resolution Safety] Can idx_to_struct_name_ref() be exploited to resolve to attacker-controlled struct names? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: StructDefinitionLoader::load_struct_definition()] [Module Loading Gas Race] Between metering the module and getting the struct, can the module be replaced causing wrong struct to be loaded? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: StructDefinitionLoader::load_layout_from_cache()] [Layout Cache Consistency] When unpacking (layout, modules), is there a TOCTOU race where modules have been modified since layout was cached? (High)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: StructDefinitionLoader::load_layout_from_cache()] [Module Re-charging Attack] Does re-charging gas for all modules in the layout cause users to pay more gas for cached layouts than for computing new ones? (Medium)

[File: third_party/move/move-vm/runtime/src/storage/loader/lazy.rs] [Impl: StructDefinitionLoader::load_layout_from_cache()] [Cache Invalidation on Module Publish] Does module publishing properly invalidate all cached layouts that depend on the published module? (Critical)
